comment: Had I known better, I would have NEVER enrolled in this class. I believe that she thinks she is teaching at a pre-school or middle school. We are taking this class online and she says"no phones or email". This is a graduate level course I don't expect to be micromanaged. No guidance on the exams. You are completely blind. I would NOT take her ever
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great professor. Very clear and helpful. Trains students to be more professional. Shares very good examples.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: She is unreasonably hard for a business elective that many students take before graduation. She gives 0 guidance on what will be on her very difficult tests. A hard and time-consuming project that she is very picky about. No phone or laptop... Overall starts out nice and then turns into a very rude and arrogant person. I would avoid if possible.

If your looking for a easy final elective before you graduate, don't take this class. Miss 3 classes? FAIL. Using your phone or laptop? Kicked out of class. Two group projects, three tests and a whole lot of boring lectures that are only benenfical if you plan on being a family business consultant. This class was worse than a freshman into course.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She made this class harder than needed. Very sarcastic and spiteful. Be careful.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Great professor. Very clear and helpful. Teaches students to be more professional.

Be prepared this class is a bit difficult, I got an B. Her study guides are helpful if you read the textbook as well you'll do fine on the test. Test are all concepts and have a few ?'s about the guest lecture as well. The hardest thing you'll have to face is the FTP. Your given VERY LITTLE direction and you have to make a report using POLC terms.

She seems to be a nice lady, however much of what time she does put into instruction is mostly irrelevant psychobabble.  She wants the main project and reflection paper to also be psychobabble. The project, reflection paper, and peer evaluation comprise 50% of your grade. Only 50% comes from tests/homework, where you actually show what you learned.

She's really, REALLY hard. I can't express that enough. She's nice and approachable, but her study guides don't make any sense, her notes in class are irrelevant to the test, and there's a group project that's 35% of your grade. She's HARD. I wouldn't take her again. I regret doing it now. She's much easier to understand though.

Attendence is mandatory for class and you are allowed only 4 absences for a MWF class. She closes the door 5 mins after class begins and doesn't let you in. Group project is almost half of your grade. A lot of online homework, hard to understand accent, and she is a very diffult grader. Approach with caution.

I like the class and some of her teaching methods but if you don't get a good group it can make the class experience go way down hill. Also make sure you do the homework and keep up with it because you don't really get second chances. One last note, attend all classes. After 4 absences, she starts deducting .25 per day from your overall grade

Highly recommend this professor. She truly has a heart for students and for making sure we leave her class with knowledge that is applicable to our future careers. Easy exams. Make sure you get a good group to work with for the field team project and you will be fine! Do not procrastinate and ask for her help-Attainable A.

Great professor. REALLY cares about you and your learning experience. Makes sure that you leave the class with more knowledge than when you started it. Got to shadow a real company and provide consolation for them. Great experience. Take this class. (Family Business Consulting for MBA)

I took her 2 week Maymester Family Business and Consulting class.  It was the best class I have EVER taken at a school in my life.  We got to go to  major companies such as JAS, Chick-fil-A Corporate Headquarters, LTI, Elf on the Shelf and Candoni.  Had a bunch of awesome guest speakers.  I was truly sad when this class ended.

She is so great ! One of my Favorite professors at kennesaw. Really nice. Sometimes the instructions are unclear but just have a good group and be creative. The online homework was a pain! I got an A in the class and the tests are easy.The Field Team Project is a lot of work but really does help with real world experience!

Gaia is one of my favorite professors. She has extensive real world experience in management which is why the group project is so important, but vaguely explained, on purpose, to demonstrate how things work in upper management, you are given a task and expected to accomplish it without help. When you are in the big leagues that is how it is done.
This professor is awesome. Lots of work but definitely worth it.

This is the most professional professor in the college! She has class and great control over her students, she is determined to make sure you learn! Very well organized and very helpful.  This is a real college class!! She has real world knowledge! Oh and she's Italian!

Gaia is AMAZING! Definitely the most helpful professor I have ever had! She is always willing to help her students and do what is best for them. Attendance is required, but it's worth it! By far the best professor ever.

Overall, this class was interesting. It was paced suitably. Gaia is a very helpful professor. Connect HW assignments account for a large portion of grade. Tests were great for me. The biggest chunk of your grade will come from a field team project, so make sure you have a strong group. Biggest downside is her instructions are not always so clear.

Gaia is awesome. The class wasn't the easiest but she really wants everyone to learn. She wants class participation and you have a group project. Make sure you get with a team that cares. Shes the type of teacher that if you do well in her class and get to know her as a person, she will probably give you a good reference.

She gives you no instructions on your project and later tells you it's because "you won't be told what do to by your boss". I'm told exactly what to do by my boss and know many people working for companies that know exactly what they're supposed to do. She's just stupid and doesn't know what she's talking about.Class was huge waste of time.

Her accent and "sayings" are very annoying and horrible. She calls out students and treats you like a 12 year old. Not a good teacher at all, not sure how she got passed her OWN interview process. Unfortunately, it looks like Kennesaw was fulfilling a "quota" with this teacher.

I enjoyed this class on some days and dreaded it on others. this was a business elective for me and it was unfortunately not very useful info for me.  If you are involved in a family business or thinking about starting one, this may be a great class, but the small periods of intense work and occasional disorganization make it hard to recommend.

She is one of my favorite teachers by far. 3 tests that aren't worth much of your grade, easy hw that is worth a lot of your grade. And a project that she makes really fun. I loved this class. You will learn so much practical stuff that you will actually use someday. TAKE HER! she is easy on the eyes, she is italian and she is just a great teacher.

Good Professor.  There is a team project that lasts all semester and you will have a lot of work to do in the last third of the semester.  Very helpful and more than happy to answer any questions about assignments.  You will learn a lot about working with one another in teams.

Was relatively pleased with her style. She puts HEAVY weight on your team project, and is very vague with instruction, but with a purpose. She's very nice and helpful if you are having problems. The exams don't have hardly any weight, which is good because English isn't her first language and it shows in the wording of the questions.. Overall good.
Not recommended! She is bad at time management and wait until last minute to grade our project and report. But she seems nice. 50% of the grade is the project.
Overall a good teacher. The online homework she requires is time consuming and useless. The guest lectures are usually quite informative.

Dr. Marchisio is a great professor. She's very sweet and willing to answer any questions. Attendance is mandatory. There is a group project but if you have at least 3 other dedicated members you will get an 'A' on it. A little effort goes a long way in this course.

The group project was confusing because we had no idea what she wanted. There are online assignments that require the book and they are worth 20% of your grade, so stay on top of those. I got an A but was bored to tears. If you are a girl she won't mess with you. If you are a guy she will call you out in class.

I thought she was a cool professor.  She is from Italy so she does have an accent.  Her lectures do not come from the book, but the homework online does.  I didnt buy the book and I did fine.  She is a little out there, but has the best intentions.  40% of your grade is a group project. The three tests are curved. I would take her again.

She did not post grades for half the assignments and had way too many assignments to do. She would give us extra work to do if we had an extra day off for a holiday. The main part of the class was a big group project that she does not explain very well and waits till the last minute to answer any questions if she even answers them.
Boring and not easy to understand. Way to much work asssigned.
Attendance is mandatory but a complete waste of time, read the book and you will do well on the tests. There is a required team project, not hard if you have the right people. Overall easy A/B

Great professor! She has chapter online quizzes, so you'll need the text. Stidy her powerpoints and read the text. Pick a good team and you'll do great. Be creative and confident in her class and it should be a breeze.

Good class.  Online Quizzes for every chapter covered and two Tests.  The major part of the course was the FTP Project.  Get a good group or you will be doing LOTS of work.  Professor is very understanding and caring.  I got an A but I did work for it.  I would definitely recommend this class !
Did not enjoy her class. Did not learn much.

this professor should teach more classes. Like maybe Mgt 4190. Great experience, great lectures, reasonable tests, and a great group project. if you think this class is over working you you need to change majors because business is not for you.
Cares about the students and easy to talk to
Difficult to understand at times and assigns hard class project. I would not recommend.
going to class was useless but mandatory .

One of the best proffesors I have had at KSU. She really cares about her students and she is willing to help. The book will be used to take online quizzes. YOu must attend her class. Overall she is a great teacher. I highly recommend her.
Very good teacher. Really cares about her students. Very smart and knows what she is doing. In the end you will understand! One of the best professors at KSU, but attend everyone of her classes!
You will understand the material by the end of the semester.

BEST TEACHER EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!! :) Can only recommend here. She is always there and helpful and cares a lot about her students. She is funny, very motivated which helps at a late night class. I would ALWAYS take her againand wish there were more like her!!!
great prof, Italian, likes to let the class discuss things. I never took notes, read the chapters once or twice, got an A

Awesome teacher.  Italian, Hot, Informative, Passionate about the class, and overall a great, great teacher.  Take her for Mgt 3100.  A lot of work, but that is was college is all about.  Im a C student and got an "A" in this class.
Prof. Marchisio is awesome!!

BEST TEACHER EVER!!!!!!! So nice and helpful. Completely knows her subject and is very motivated. Keeps your attention the whole time even though it is a late night class. Very quick at responding and always available for help. Not much work at all. This was the easiest and low key class all semester long. Only two exams: midterm and the final. eas

Didn't think i was doing good in the class and just busted my ass at the end...got an A out of no where and i'll take it...very very nice lady and will work with you and helps out a lot!! Sexy Accent!!~

Prof. Marchisio is very well qualified and she is a great educator. Take her class if you are a management major, you really learn a lot. The things you should do; go to class, pay attention, do ALL the work and always ask if you don’t understand something. She is very supportive and she is always there to answer questions via e mail or after class

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!  Nobody ever knew what she was talking about.  You can only be absent 2 times before she takes off points on your final grade.  She gives you TONS of work and projects all the time.  Claims that everything is in the syllabus, but she doubles the work load by the end of the semester. VERY UNCLEAR..don't take her..

Do not take unless you want to fill your brain with confusion!  Very unclear class structure...felt like i was playing where's waldo on web ct looking for assignments that are due...group project sucks and no one really understood what to do at all...she does dress nice and has a fancy array of attire!!

Very unclear and hard to understand. She is very understanding but she has to be when she confuses that many students. There is alot of online work/web ct stuff to do and its just thrown up there. So alot of times you will miss things. I would not take another class with this lady. Although she is very nice just not good at teaching.
